column1: '''Old Winyards''' was a place in [[the Shire]]'s [[Southfarthing]]<ref name="nomen"/>
column2: noted for its production of strong wines of the same name.

column3: seems to have laid down a large number of bottles of "Old Winyards". His son
column4: [[Bilbo Baggins]] gave a present of a dozen bottles to [[Rorimac Brandybuck]]
column5: [[Master of Buckland]] at the time he left the Shire
column6: <ref>{{FR|I1}}</ref> but this still left plenty for his heir [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]]. The Old Winyards lasted another seventeen years
column7: until the last drop was drunk by Frodo as he set out on his own adventures.<ref>{{FR|I3}}</ref>

column1: The name means "the Old Vineyards".<ref name="nomen">{{HM|N}}
Winyard is a real-life place-name in England
column2: and [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] notes that it descends from [[Old English]] before the assimilation to Romance stem ''vin-''.<ref name="nomen"/>
